TI: The effects of unilateral 6-hydroxydopamine lesions in the substantia nigra on hippocampal noradrenaline-induced feeding and other behaviour in the rat.
AB: The latency, duration of feeding and number of feeding periods recorded from rats after noradrenaline injection to the hippocampus show little change after unilateral 6-hydroxydopamine injections to the substantia nigra. It is suggested that 6-hydroxydopamine-induced weight losses result from non-specific effects of injection because increased durations for grooming, decreased latencies for resting and short periods of feeding follow injection.
AD: Zoologisches Institut der Technischen Hochschule, 61 Darmstadt, Schnittspahnstrasse 3 G.F.R.
